message_1: A car travels with a speed of 60 km/h from point A to point B. The distance between point A and point B is 180 km. Using abductive logic, estimate the time taken by the car to travel from point A to point B.
message_2:
To estimate the time taken by the car to travel from point A to point B, we can use the formula:

Time = Distance / Speed

In this case, the distance is 180 km and the speed is 60 km/h. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Time = 180 km / 60 km/h = 3 hours

So, the car will take approximately 3 hours to travel from point A to point B.
